Balance & mobility symptom reports

Male, 40 - 59 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
40 2021-01-03 balance disorder, dizziness, vertigo I received the vaccine 30 min. prior to starting my shift as a Nurse in the ED. About 1 hour after r... Read more
Close
I received the vaccine 30 min. prior to starting my shift as a Nurse in the ED. About 1 hour after receiving the shot while standing I felt off balance and began to have a vertigo like dizziness. I sat down and tried to drink some water but began spitting the water back up and dry heaving after trying to drink. I did not feel nauseous if I was not drinking. I did feel the sensation of a slight lump in my throat. I did not have any shortness of breath, tachycardia, rash or fever. I did not want to check in as a patient so I called my wife to come and pick me up from work. Before I left I had the pharmacy send me some Pepcid and Benadryl and I took 25mg of Benadryl and 20mg of Pepcid before leaving. I left work around 1400 and now at 1500 I am able to drink fluids. The slight lump in my throat seems to have improved. I still feel a little dizzy and off balance.
40 2021-01-04 dizziness Experienced dizzy spell lasting 5-10 minutes approximately one hour after immunization
40 2021-01-04 dizziness Patient reports dizzy spell that lasted about 5-10 min aproximately one hour after immunization.
40 2021-01-05 dizziness Dizziness, HYPERtension, flushing, tingling on one side of the body- opposite side from injection N... Read more
Close
Dizziness, HYPERtension, flushing, tingling on one side of the body- opposite side from injection Narrative: dizziness, tingling, flushing, on left side of head down to left foot immediately after injection at 1148. BP increased to 168/104 with HR of 103 at 1211.
40 2021-01-08 dizziness Dizziness, Headache & NauseaVomiting Narrative:
40 2021-01-10 dizziness, gait disturbance After about 15 minutes, I began to feel lightheaded and experience a tingling in my arms/hands. I'd ... Read more
Close
After about 15 minutes, I began to feel lightheaded and experience a tingling in my arms/hands. I'd guess it was related to the nerves in the arms, because it specifically affected my pinky and ring fingers on both hands. I was also unsteady on my feet, but did not lose consciousness. The lightheadedness and tingling continued off and on for most of the day. The tingling appeared to go away the next day, but I still experienced periodic (though rare) feelings of lightheadedness. Perhaps 2-3 time the next day (Saturday) and experienced maybe 1-2 times the following day (Sunday). I did not take Adderall on the weekend. On Monday, I did take Adderall and returned to work, where I experience some tingling again and longer bouts of lightheadedness. Again, I have not lost consciousness.
40 2021-01-11 fall, dizziness Patient received the Maderna Covid-19 vaccine. Was sitting in observation for 10 minutes post vacci... Read more
Close
Patient received the Maderna Covid-19 vaccine. Was sitting in observation for 10 minutes post vaccine and got up to "make a call." I was called to the conference room at 0815. Caregivers heard a loud noise and found patient on the ground in the hallway right outside the observation room. Patient states "I got dizzy and started getting tunnel vision" also states that this happens at times with needles/ blood draws since he was a kid. Patient set up on his own, denies head/neck pain. Denies any injury. Stood on his own and guided into observation for more time- set in chair. 0832 checked with patient , still denies injury, denies anymore dizziness. Encouraged him to go to the ED to get checked out. Patient denies head/neck pain or any S/S at this time. Declines ED. 0847- Patient denies dizziness, s/s and declines going to ED. Walked out, gait steady.
40 2021-01-17 injected limb mobility decreased Around 12hrs of first injection, I began to feel very cold. Left arm was very painful to move. Hand... Read more
Close
Around 12hrs of first injection, I began to feel very cold. Left arm was very painful to move. Hands and feet felt like ice. I was shivering. Fever of 102. Could not sleep. I was up at 3am feeling like I was going to vomit and I couldn?t get warm. Whole body aches. Couldn?t go in to work the next morning. I had a terrible headache. Slept all day. Went to bed in the evening and woke again at 3am shivering uncontrollably. Hands have continued to stay cold. No appetite as well.
40 2021-01-21 balance disorder, vertigo Sore shoulder started after a couple of hours and was moderate by evening. A general unusual feeling... Read more
Close
Sore shoulder started after a couple of hours and was moderate by evening. A general unusual feeling started within a couple hours of the shot. By 7pm I started to experience chills and joint fatigue in legs (knees, toes). Chills became severe and a low grade fever of 100.6 developed. Chills lasted about 1.5hrs. Fever broke overnight. By morning all previous issues were resolved and the only issue was a problem with equilibrium and balance (and sore shoulder) It was a general feeling similar to drunkenness. This issue persisted throughout the day and by evening I was experiencing mild vertigo when I closed my eyes. I went to bed feeling somewhat improved relative to all the symptoms but woke having experienced a cold sweat. My shirt was completely soaked. I noted several less significant sweating issues throughout this day with no other side effects. This was the final day with notable symptoms. At the time of this report I have minor shoulder pain as the only symptom that persisted throughout. The equilibrium symptoms were severe enough that I missed a day of work.
40 2021-01-22 dizziness, vertigo Onset of dizziness in the am. Gradually a little milder at time of report (2:45 pm). Head is swirli... Read more
Close
Onset of dizziness in the am. Gradually a little milder at time of report (2:45 pm). Head is swirling. No history of dizziness.
40 2021-01-23 dizziness Shortly after the shot: - Dizziness - Weakness Later: - Sore left arm - Chest pain, left side - Fat... Read more
Close
Shortly after the shot: - Dizziness - Weakness Later: - Sore left arm - Chest pain, left side - Fatigue - Anxiety, perhaps triggered by all of that.
40 2021-01-23 dizziness Severe dizziness started around 10:00pm then got a little better around 6 am the next day. Hardly go... Read more
Close
Severe dizziness started around 10:00pm then got a little better around 6 am the next day. Hardly got any sleep that night. Then around 8am I started to have chills which then I checked my temp and it was 101.0 degrees F. Then I started to get a headache and severe body aches. Around 3pm I tried to eat something which I then threw it up. I tried to drink water and flavored water which I also threw up the water. I also went into the bathtub 7 times that day to stop the chills. Which it did but right when I got out they started again which then I felt worse. Around 11pm 1/23/2021 I ended up going into the ER which then they gave me IV fluids and then Benadryl and Toradol by IV. After those were administered I started feeling better which then I was discharged and went home.
40 2021-01-26 dizziness adverse event: dizzy, lightheaded treatment: observation outcome: released by ems after 30 min
40 2021-01-26 dizziness Muscle spasm and tightness in shoulders, neck and back. Dizziness, Diaphoresis, elevate heart rate, ... Read more
Close
Muscle spasm and tightness in shoulders, neck and back. Dizziness, Diaphoresis, elevate heart rate, nausea.
40 2021-01-26 joint stiffness Onset at 14 hours - malaise, fever, arthralgias for 36 hours Onset at 36 hours - Facial burning, red... Read more
Close
Onset at 14 hours - malaise, fever, arthralgias for 36 hours Onset at 36 hours - Facial burning, redness, swelling
40 2021-01-28 mobility decreased Severe discomfort in left shoulder limiting movement began roughly 6 hours after injection and persi... Read more
Close
Severe discomfort in left shoulder limiting movement began roughly 6 hours after injection and persisted for 48 before subsiding to minor discomfort. On Jan 28, 10 days after injection, left shoulder pain resurgence occurred, again severely limiting range of motion of the arm. After 20 hours pain is still persistent and severe
40 2021-01-31 dizziness Oscillopsia, dizziness 10 hours later. Gradually subsided over 8 days, but still persists as if this... Read more
Close
Oscillopsia, dizziness 10 hours later. Gradually subsided over 8 days, but still persists as if this report.
40 2021-02-01 dizziness, balance disorder Shortly after receiving shot (within the 20 minute observation period) patient began to feel very di... Read more
Close
Shortly after receiving shot (within the 20 minute observation period) patient began to feel very dizzy to the point of not feeling steady enough to stand. He said he felt like his head was being compressed. His lower lip began to feel numb and tingly, eventually this feeling spread into his mouth and throat. He was coherent the entire time. He received oral Benadryl while waiting for his wife to arrive to drive him to the emergency room.
40 2021-02-01 joint range of motion decreased Patient experienced mild pain immediately after injection. Soreness increased over the coming 2 hour... Read more
Close
Patient experienced mild pain immediately after injection. Soreness increased over the coming 2 hours, becoming severe. The soreness continued to worsen, turning into sharp, stabbing pain that remained local to the injection site and surrounding ligaments. Range of motion was severely restricted with arm elevation above shoulder height extremely painful. The severe pain continued for 36 hours. Acetaminophen and ibuprofen provided relief. Mild ligament pain continues on abduction and flexion on the left shoulder and arm at time of report (09:26 PM on 02/02/2021).
40 2021-02-01 mobility decreased Bilateral neck stiffness with limited mobility, nausea and vomiting. Started next day and persisted... Read more
Close
Bilateral neck stiffness with limited mobility, nausea and vomiting. Started next day and persisted. ER visit on 1/12 migraine cocktail and bilateral nerve blockers no assistance. Used anti-inflammatory meds, acetaminophen and Zofran for daily treatment. Progression of symptoms got worse occurring with double vision. Had ER visit after several test listed below diagnosed with aseptic meningitis. Placed on pain killer and steroids treatment to subside symptoms.
40 2021-02-07 dizziness 3:15 - Pt was leaning against wall c/o being dizzy and going to pass out - Pt was moved to reclining... Read more
Close
3:15 - Pt was leaning against wall c/o being dizzy and going to pass out - Pt was moved to reclining position - BP 144/100, RR 44, HR 120 - No itching ect. - Respirations rapid - O2 62 - Cannula applied - Pt continued c/o thinking he would pass out - Color pink - 3:15 1 cc Benedryl administered in R arm - 3:27 Epi 1 dose (0.7 cc) administered in R thigh - 3:30 EMS arrived - 3:34 EMS transferred pt to Medical Center
40 2021-02-07 dizziness Elevated heart rate (130 at rest for 10+ hours, my normal is 70-80) Elevated blood pressure (150/89 ... Read more
Close
Elevated heart rate (130 at rest for 10+ hours, my normal is 70-80) Elevated blood pressure (150/89 at rest for 10 + hours, my normal is 110/70) Extreme headache, light sensitive Nausea Mild anaphylaxis itching/burning/tingling in lips, tongue and throat Feeling of intoxication, disoriented, slurred speech, dizziness Rash/redness that spread beyond injection site on to back of shoulder Agitation Itchiness Peeling of skin in mouth/cheeks Blisters on roof of mouth Chest tightness with normal breathing Jaw pain Treatment as listed below; continue with Benadryl every 6 hours and ibuprofen; return if symptoms continue or worsen
40 2021-02-11 mobility decreased Fever, chills, extreme fatigue, severe pain at injection site that radiates up the shoulder to the n... Read more
Close
Fever, chills, extreme fatigue, severe pain at injection site that radiates up the shoulder to the neck and down the arm to the elbow causing limited mobility
40 2021-02-17 dizziness On Day 6, I started feeling tightness around the rotater cuff and inner arm muscle. On Day 8 I start... Read more
Close
On Day 6, I started feeling tightness around the rotater cuff and inner arm muscle. On Day 8 I started feeling extreme fatigue and weakness. On Day 9 I started feeling extreme dizziness, as well as itchiness and raised rash on the injection site.
40 2021-02-24 vertigo I had extreme chills, aches, muscle pain, vertigo, headache, and fatigue for 72 hours. At one poin... Read more
Close
I had extreme chills, aches, muscle pain, vertigo, headache, and fatigue for 72 hours. At one point is was so bad i could just lay with my eyes closed and could not sleep but just lay there. I had to take off of work and was bed ridden.
40 2021-02-25 dizziness Within one minute of receiving vaccine, the patient became pale, stated that he felt dizzy and faint... Read more
Close
Within one minute of receiving vaccine, the patient became pale, stated that he felt dizzy and fainted. Patient regained consciousness within one minute. Upon regaining consciousness, patient reported feeling lightheaded and dizzy but was oriented to person, place and time. Skin was warm and dry but pale in color. After regaining consciousness, patient also stated that he has a history of fainting 5-6 years ago after receiving an influenza vaccination. (During screening questions, patient denied having any reactions to vaccines in the past) Patient independently moved from a chair to a laying down position on a cot and expressed an improvement in how he was feeling. Vital signs taken after event as recorded below. When asked patient stated that he does recall times when he thinks he may have been hypoglycemic in the past. Patient also states that he has been very nervous about receiving injections throughout his life. EMS called and assessed patient at the vaccination clinic site. Patient drank a 10 oz bottle of orange juice prior to EMS arriving and when EMS staff obtained his blood sugar the result was 97. EMS stated that patient was stable and all vital signs were stable. Patients skin color improved to pink. Patients wife was called by patient and she provided transportation home for patient. Prior to leaving the vaccination clinic, patient was walking around for several minutes and denied any feelings of being lightheaded or dizzy. VITALS SIGNS: 5:06pm: Heart rate: 50, Oxygen Saturation: 99% on room air 5:15 pm: Blood pressure: 100/78 ; Heart rate: 50; oxygen saturation 99% on room air. 5:20pm: Blood pressure 98/76 Heart rate:52; oxygen saturation 96% on room air. 5:34 pm: Blood pressure 92/68 Heart rate: 53 oxygen saturation 97% on room air. Vital signs taken by EMS staff were not recorded by public health nursing staff.
40 2021-03-01 joint range of motion decreased Right arm pain to fingers - very difficult to move right arm. Felt heavy. BP 152/88 (pulse 68).
40 2021-03-02 dizziness After receiving shot, patient reported feeling warm after sitting down in post observation area. Fel... Read more
Close
After receiving shot, patient reported feeling warm after sitting down in post observation area. Felt anxious and lightheaded. Vital signs taken x2 - stable. Offered and drank water and laid down. Feeling of warmth and lightheadedness resolved after about 10 minutes. Patient reported feeling better, conversing and laughed with clinic staff. Exited clinic after 40 minutes and observed gait was steady.
40 2021-03-04 vertigo, dizziness On 28-FEB-2021, at approximately 2000, I developed left facial numbness felt on top of the left fore... Read more
Close
On 28-FEB-2021, at approximately 2000, I developed left facial numbness felt on top of the left forehead, left eyebrow, left nasal bridge, inside of left nose (nares), top and bottom of left lip, left side of the cheek, and left side of the tongue. Left eye blin is weak and unable to fully close left eye. Left ear was aggravated and irritated when scratched. Hearing is distorted, felt as if I had been submerged in water for a prolonged amount of time. There is ringing at times on left ear as well. Symptoms were progressive. Today (05-MAR-2021), also developed vertiginous sensation and light-headedness.
40 2021-03-07 dizziness Dry mouth, dizziness and throat tightness. Benadryl 25 mg oral administered by . Pt was observed for... Read more
Close
Dry mouth, dizziness and throat tightness. Benadryl 25 mg oral administered by . Pt was observed for an additional 30 min, symptoms improved. Pt discharged home.
40 2021-03-10 dizziness severe headache, fever, dizziness, nausea/vomiting, achiness, fatigue
40 2021-03-16 dizziness It has been 6 weeks since my 2nd dose of the Moderna vaccine for Covid-19. For the first 3-4 days I ... Read more
Close
It has been 6 weeks since my 2nd dose of the Moderna vaccine for Covid-19. For the first 3-4 days I had the usual moderate flu-like symptoms: dizziness, headaches, fatigue, chills, soreness at vaccine siteetc. Days 5-7 I seemed to gradually improve. On day 8 all of the symptoms returned with greater severity: this time I had a fever, the chills were much more intense, the headaches were excruciating, body and joint aches all over the place--I couldn't sleep or focus on anything cognitively taxing. Interestingly, my brother, who was vaccinated just after me, also had more severe side effects beginning on day 8 post 2nd dose. He improved after 3-4 days, but my recovery has been much much lengthier. By day 14 I was still feeling very ill, though the fever did subside. Sometime in the third week the pain in my arm at the vaccination site returned, then became intermittent, and still bothers me from time to time. I also started getting muscle spasms in the same exact locations that sent me to the ER after my probably bout with Covid in the spring of 2020. Thankfully these lasted only a week or so, though I began feeling muscle soreness in different parts of my body, ever changing. By the 4th week I was slightly better and down to 4 main symptoms: chills (by far the worst of the symptoms--to the point at which my skin would feel like it was being frostbitten by dry ice every time I changed sweaty clothes), occasional splitting headaches, and muscle soreness that included both the injection site on my arm and other areas. I had other symptoms as well, fatigue and brain fog, etc, but these were present before the vaccination, though not as severe.
40 2021-03-18 dizziness Patient was waiting for 15 minute after injection. She felt her heart rate was high, checked her wat... Read more
Close
Patient was waiting for 15 minute after injection. She felt her heart rate was high, checked her watch fitbit, heart rate read 120 bpm. Also was lightheaded. Staff was made aware. 0900 RN assessed patient, HR was 86 with regular beats palpated at the wrist, and ausculated at the heart. Respirations were 18 and regular, Oxygens saturations 96%, B/P 142/86, Patient was alert and orientated. Patient reported at 0902 she was feeling better. Rapid response was called at 0900. At 0908 HR 106, slightly lightheaded, rapid response arrived and transferred patient to ER at 0913 by wheelchair. Patient was alert and oriented.
40 2021-03-21 dizziness 12:14 Post vaccination reports feeling dizzy, diaphoretic, color flushed and pale; medical monitorin... Read more
Close
12:14 Post vaccination reports feeling dizzy, diaphoretic, color flushed and pale; medical monitoring w/vitals assessed: BP 93/53 P55 O2 sat 96%RA, rest w/feet elevated, po hydration provided, answering questions; 12:30 BP 101/71 P77 02 sat 98% RA , status improving, remains coherent; 1240 BP 107/78 P 72 reports "feeling better", stands w/no dizziness or reports of additional symptoms, color returns to normal; Released from facility w/self.
40 2021-03-22 dizziness Approx1255: Patient stated he was not feeling well, light-headed. Patient pale, sweating. He asked... Read more
Close
Approx1255: Patient stated he was not feeling well, light-headed. Patient pale, sweating. He asked to lie down. Encouraged to take deep breaths. Patient asked to step outside of room, assisted to hallway chair for air. Wife at side, encouraging to take deep breaths. Patient stated he could not see us and slumped in chair with eyes open and glazed. Shallow breathing, unresponsive to sternal rub. Lips noted to turn purple-blue and then gray. Called for assistance and LVN at patient side obtaining VS, patient took deep breath and started to become responsive. VS at approx. 1303: BP104/47, HR 57, 02 Sat 95%. Patient talking, continued pale and diaphoretic. 911 called and EMS arrived at approx. 1305 Transferred to hospital.
40 2021-03-22 dizziness Sore injection site Light-headed Mild nausea Mild headache General feeling of unwellness
40 2021-03-22 injected limb mobility decreased "Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA" Several hours after receiving first dose of vaccine my left arm beca... Read more
Close
"Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA" Several hours after receiving first dose of vaccine my left arm became very painful to the point of bringing me to tears whenever I tried to move it or use it: lifting something as simple as a glass of water was excruciating pain. Second day is a little better with a little more mobility, but trying to undress and undress is torture, especially lifting my arm over my head or past my chest.
40 2021-03-22 mobility decreased A little less than 3 hours after getting the shot, I noticed the injection site was getting very sor... Read more
Close
A little less than 3 hours after getting the shot, I noticed the injection site was getting very sore. Within about a half hour of first noticing it, that entire muscle was aching a lot. It?s now 4:50pm and it hurts to lift my arm, reach for anything, I can even feel it just by typing this out. I?ve also noticed I?m pretty tired, my joints feel very achey like when I have a cold, and I?m incredibly thirsty. The pain in the muscle at injection site is by far the worst symptom though. It?s extremely painful. I did not expect that since it didn?t hurt when getting the actual shot. Took my temp and it?s normal. The aching joints are far less painful than my arm, but are an issue nonetheless. Had I known this would happen beforehand, I would still get the shot, so as long as it doesn?t get a lot worse or something else haplens, all in all I?d have to say it was worth it.
40 2021-03-23 fall Shortly after receiving the vaccine, the patient stood up from his chair and approached the pharmacy... Read more
Close
Shortly after receiving the vaccine, the patient stood up from his chair and approached the pharmacy counter. He told the pharmacist he was starting to feel funny and immediately fell on his back. I ran out to around the counter and he was conscious and sweaty. He was responsive, knew his name and where he was. He described feeling very hot. He did not have any rash or swelling visible.
40 2021-03-24 vertigo Began to have tinnitus after ~5 hours, fullness of ears and pain in face/right ear. Have no history ... Read more
Close
Began to have tinnitus after ~5 hours, fullness of ears and pain in face/right ear. Have no history of tinnitus. Approximately 5 days later, began to experience vertigo. It is now 8 days and there has been no reduction in either symptom after being subscribed prednisone.
40 2021-04-12 gait inability On 4/8/21 awoke to intense pain in his left foot about 12 hours after receiving his 1st dose Moderna... Read more
Close
On 4/8/21 awoke to intense pain in his left foot about 12 hours after receiving his 1st dose Moderna vaccine batch #038B21A. Over the next few days swelling and pain increased in the left foot moving around from the big toe, to ankle, to arch. His foot was swollen and extremely painful and he was not able to walk or put weight on the foot. On 4/18 he went to the clinic. The doctor took fluid from the big toe joint to test uric acid levels. Elevated levels of uric acid confirmed his condition to be Gout and Indomethacin was prescribed for pain and swelling. He has never had Gout or any kind of arthritis, joint pain or foot injury prior to the Moderna vaccine. As of 4/13/21 he is still unable to walk or sleep well due to pain and swelling in the foot. He is not able to work or resume normal daily activities.
40 2021-04-15 dizziness Stroke; Gotten very sick from vaccine; Tachycardia; Blood pressure issues; Dizziniess; Heart rate is... Read more
Close
Stroke; Gotten very sick from vaccine; Tachycardia; Blood pressure issues; Dizziniess; Heart rate issues; This spontaneous case was reported by an other health care professional and describes the occurrence of CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT (Stroke) in a 40-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch no. #027L20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included COVID-19 (hospitalized for 7 days; treated with Remdesivir; long recovery) from 11-Sep-2020 to October 2020. Concurrent medical conditions included Blood pressure (ongoing issues) and Heart rate (ongoing issues). On 05-Jan-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 03-Mar-2021, the patient experienced CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT (Stroke) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). On an unknown date, the patient experienced ILLNESS (Gotten very sick from vaccine), TACHYCARDIA (Tachycardia), BLOOD PRESSURE FLUCTUATION (Blood pressure issues), DIZZINESS (Dizziniess) and HEART RATE IRREGULAR (Heart rate issues). At the time of the report, CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT (Stroke), ILLNESS (Gotten very sick from vaccine), TACHYCARDIA (Tachycardia), BLOOD PRESSURE FLUCTUATION (Blood pressure issues), DIZZINESS (Dizziniess) and HEART RATE IRREGULAR (Heart rate issues) outcome was unknown. DIAGNOSTIC RESULTS (normal ranges are provided in parenthesis if available): On 25-Mar-2021, SARS-CoV-2 antibody test: 9.64 after one round of the vaccine. On an unknown date, SARS-CoV-2 antibody test: 220 natural antibodies after 2 months. mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) was withdrawn on an unknown date. For mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular), the reporter did not provide any causality assessments. Patient reports that he had worked for an urgent care performing testing and contracted COVID-19 back in 11SEP2020. Patient was hospitalized for 7 days, was administered Remdesivir, and had a long recovery. Patient reports having issues regulating his blood pressure and heart rate so bad that he had almost died during that time. The recovery took up until 1st week of October and did not feel well until then. Patient reports it was advised to defer first dose of vaccination for COVID-19 for 3 months. Patient self-medicated with OTC Tylenol and Advil which did not help. Patient reports that he was hospitalized a second time around last month (03MAR2021 approximately) for experiencing a stroke. Symptoms felt like he was experiencing a mini-COVID-19 episode and was having a relapse of COVID-19. ER professional advised patient to never take the second dose of the vaccine. Patient reports taking an antibody test (after a single dose of the vaccine) for both natural and for the spike protein on 25MAR2021. Patient reports that he had gotten a 9.64 reading from just one round of the vaccine in comparison to the doctors he had worked who had received both doses of the vaccine, never gotten sick with COVID-19, and produced a 9.0 reading. Patient reports his natural antibodies after 2 months was at 220. Patient wishes to report this information to highlight that his natural antibodies were so high from the previous COVID-19 infection that when he had gotten the first round of the vaccine, he believes that his body rejected the vaccine so strongly that he presented with severe side effects from the vaccine. Patient would like to submit his information to show that he is proof that if someone previously had COVID-19, they should only need a single dose of the vaccine. In addition, patient expressed that if a patient's natural antibody is high, then a reduced dose should be provided or the vaccine should be deferred until natural antibodies reduce Most recent FOLLOW-UP information incorporated above includes: On 02-Apr-2021: Event details reported; Sender's Comments: Very limited information regarding the events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.

Close
15 hours after 2nd dose I experienced the following symptoms and I thought I was going to die. I couldnt get out of bed: 1) Extreme heart palpitations, my heart rate monitor was reading an extremely high stress activity for 2 days post shot. 2) Very Hot and Very Cold body chill and temp swings 3) Sweating profusely, I soaked through my pajamas on 3 different occasions when I woke up from napping. 4) My pee was orange and hurt to pee. 5) My entire body hurt the worst I've ever felt 6) All my joints were super painful, it hurt to walk and I couldn't sleep due to the pain. 7) I had the worst headache I've ever had.
41 2020-12-31 dizziness, inability to stand I work at a Hospital sterilizing surgical equipment. After I received the vaccine, the hospital sta... Read more
Close
I work at a Hospital sterilizing surgical equipment. After I received the vaccine, the hospital staff observed me for 15 minutes to see if a reaction occurred. I felt fine, and they told me I could go. I was working that day (2-10:30pm) and had gotten vaccinated at the beginning of my shift. The rest of my shift went fine. Near the end, though, my arm began to feel sore. Driving home, I began to feel tired. By the time I got home, it felt like a cold was setting in. I ate a large bowl of chicken soup to try to feel better. I stayed up a little bit, but was feeling woozy by this point and went to bed. Bad chills set in and I began to shake I felt so cold. I used a heating pad to help with this. I tried to sleep, but my head was throbbing. The next morning, I tried to sit up in bed but my first attempt proved too difficult. I took it slower. I was able to sit up eventually. Standing was also difficult. I spent the day mostly lounging on the couch. I slept a little better that night, but my head was still throbbing somewhat. No chills this time. Getting up the next morning went a little better. I was able to sit up in bed without issue and walking around did not prove as much of a chore.
41 2021-01-01 dizziness 5 minutes post vaccine administration I started to feel palpitations, numbness on both arms and went... Read more
Close
5 minutes post vaccine administration I started to feel palpitations, numbness on both arms and went up the nape/head, flushing, tingling in both arms dizziness, then dysphagia but able to talk. Hives at torso after 10 minutes. I was assessed by to physicians working at the site. Epi pen was given to me by a physician and taken by ambulance to hospital by EMTs who were there at the site. At the hospital I was given 40mg steroids by mouth. After observation for 4 hours I was feeling better, and was discharged home. Ordered to take 40mg of steroids for 2 more days. After one day post vaccination, I have significant pain at the site and body ache.

41 2021-01-14 dizziness During 15 minute observation period after administration of Moderna vaccine, patient reported feelin... Read more
Close
During 15 minute observation period after administration of Moderna vaccine, patient reported feeling dizzy and nauseous. Patient was transferred into wheelchair and brought into an examination room with provider NP. Provider and staff collected vitals, blood sugars, and HPI. Patient reported he "felt like he was going to pass out" but did not actually syncopize. Patient was with staff for well over one hour for observation, and symptoms resolved within 15 minutes of the initial onset without intervention. It was deemed likely vasovagal response by the provider.

Then that night, I woke up at 3:30 am 1/16 with severe chills, full-body aches, and high fever (although I was unable to walk to get the thermometer). During the day 1/16, as I write this, I continue to feel similar symptoms to when I was Covid positive in March 2020. Tylenol and Motrin help the symptoms to subside.

41 2021-01-22 mobility decreased Around 11:30 pm that evening I started feeling extremely warm in my face and thighs. Figuring it was... Read more
Close
Around 11:30 pm that evening I started feeling extremely warm in my face and thighs. Figuring it was due to the shot, I decide to try and lay down to sleep it off. A short time later, I awoke freezing with chills and uncontrollable shivering. My whole body hurt especially my lower back and pressure in my head. This continued throughout the night until the early morning. As the shivering and chills subsided, extreme fatigue, body aches and head pressure continued and it was difficult to get up at points. I had no appetite and forced myself to drink to stay hydrated. About 1:00 pm, I started to feel better, but that was short lived. Approximately 4:30 ? 5pm, the chills and shivering returned and I had 101 fever. I had some tea and toast and then went to bed for the night. When I awoke this morning, I felt a million times better. As of writing this email, I still have some slight fatigue, aches, and head pressure, but night and day difference from yesterday.

Close
Delayed reaction occurred 8 hrs. after receiving vaccine. Felt as if I was injected with the Flu, based on the symptoms that arose: chills, fatigue, nausea, dizziness, fever, body aches, weakness, no appetite or desire to hydrate(every single symptom was severe) These symptoms lasted 12 hrs. I chose to go in to work, instead of taking the day off. I truly believe that because I pushed my body through this painful ordeal, it helped me to overcome this Flu-like feeling that I endured for 12 hours: 10 of those at my job. I also experienced a swelling & pain in my right knee. The pain & swelling is finally subsiding as I type this report 4 days after the vaccine.

41 2021-03-18 dizziness Dizzy; short term memory sucks and it's frustrating; Can't see well; Fibromyalgia; bone pain; Neurop... Read more
Close
Dizzy; short term memory sucks and it's frustrating; Can't see well; Fibromyalgia; bone pain; Neuropathy; Feeling aches in the body; Bells palsy-paralysis on the left side of the face/ pressure on the left side of the face and neck; headache; Ringing in the ears; Pressure in the ears; A spontaneous report was received from consumer concerning a 41-year-old, male patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced pressure in ears/ear discomfort, ringing in ears/tinnitus, pressure on the left side of the face and neck which was found to be Bell's Palsy/facial paralysis, Headache, neuropathy peripheral, fibromyalgia, memory impairment, couldn't see well/visual decrease, feeling aches in the body/myalgia, and dizziness. The patient's medical history included neuropathy and fibromyalgia and past cancer. No relevant concomitant medications were reported. On 03 Feb 2021, the patient received the first of two doses of mRNA-1273 (Lot number: 028L20A) intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 24FEB2021 the patient began experiencing pressure and a ringing in the ears and then started like a pressure on the left side of the face and neck. On 25FEB2021, the patient started having a headache and on 26FEB2021 the paralysis on the left side of the face began. The patient said that it worsened, couldn't eat, couldn't speak, and went to the hospital. The patient said that they had a CT Scan, and the result was that it wasn't a stroke. Vitals were taken and blood work came back normal. The conclusion was Bell's Palsy. The patient stated that they couldn't see well and were dizzy. The patient said that they were experiencing fibromyalgia and neuropathy that they had when they had cancer. The patient also mentioned that they were experiencing some bone pain and that their short term memory was not good and was frustrating. Treatment of these events were not reported. The outcome of the events, ear discomfort, tinnitus, facial paralysis, headache, neuropathy peripheral, fibromyalgia, memory impairment, visual decrease, myalgia and dizziness were considered unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. The patient's medical history of neuropathy, fibromyalgia and past history of cancer remains the contributing factors. Further information has been requested.

41 2021-04-15 dizziness, joint range of motion decreased buckling and hyperextending; dislocated finger; all foot bones moving; every joint slipped out of pl... Read more
Close
buckling and hyperextending; dislocated finger; all foot bones moving; every joint slipped out of place; can't bend; sacrum and buttock burning; light headed; Body tender; Felt jowly and loose; Migraine; headaches; Searing left knee pain; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of DIZZINESS (light headed) in a 41-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 0A16M20 and 030L20A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event (No reported medical history). Concomitant products included SUMATRIPTAN SUCCINATE (IMITREX DF) for an unknown indication. On 28-Jan-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 25-Feb-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 25-Feb-2021, the patient experienced MIGRAINE (Migraine; headaches) and ARTHRALGIA (Searing left knee pain). On 01-Mar-2021, the patient experienced FEELING ABNORMAL (Felt jowly and loose). On an unknown date, the patient experienced DIZZINESS (light headed) (seriousness criterion medically significant), JOINT HYPEREXTENSION (buckling and hyperextending), JOINT DISLOCATION (dislocated finger; all foot bones moving; every joint slipped out of place), JOINT RANGE OF MOTION DECREASED (can't bend), SKIN IRRITATION (sacrum and buttock burning) and MYALGIA (Body tender). At the time of the report, DIZZINESS (light headed), MIGRAINE (Migraine; headaches), FEELING ABNORMAL (Felt jowly and loose), JOINT HYPEREXTENSION (buckling and hyperextending), JOINT DISLOCATION (dislocated finger; all foot bones moving; every joint slipped out of place), JOINT RANGE OF MOTION DECREASED (can't bend), SKIN IRRITATION (sacrum and buttock burning), ARTHRALGIA (Searing left knee pain) and MYALGIA (Body tender) outcome was unknown. The patient received treatment with prednisone and sumatriptan. Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested. This case was linked to MOD-2021-058046 (Patient Link).; Sender's Comments: Very limited information regarding these events has been provided at this time. Further information has been requested.
41 2021-04-23 inability to stand, dizziness, vertigo head spinning; dizzy; tired; pain at injection site; nauseas; cold sweats; really weak; could barely... Read more
Close
head spinning; dizzy; tired; pain at injection site; nauseas; cold sweats; really weak; could barely stand up; sick to his stomach; Passed out to sleep at 745 pm; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out to sleep at 745 pm) in a 41-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 037B21A and 044A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. Concurrent medical conditions included Asthma and Hyperthyroidism. Concomitant products included FLUTICASONE PROPIONATE (FLOVENT) for an unknown indication. On 22-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 19-Apr-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 19-Apr-2021, after starting mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine), the patient experienced LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out to sleep at 745 pm) (seriousness criterion medically significant). On 19-Apr-2021 at 11:30 PM, the patient experienced COLD SWEAT (cold sweats), ASTHENIA (really weak), DYSSTASIA (could barely stand up) and ILLNESS (sick to his stomach). On 20-Apr-2021, the patient experienced VERTIGO (head spinning), DIZZINESS (dizzy), FATIGUE (tired), VACCINATION SITE PAIN (pain at injection site) and NAUSEA (nauseas). At the time of the report, LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS (Passed out to sleep at 745 pm), COLD SWEAT (cold sweats), ASTHENIA (really weak), DYSSTASIA (could barely stand up), ILLNESS (sick to his stomach), VERTIGO (head spinning), DIZZINESS (dizzy), FATIGUE (tired), VACCINATION SITE PAIN (pain at injection site) and NAUSEA (nauseas) had not resolved. Not Provided Products known to have been used by the patient, within two weeks prior to the event, included thyroid medication. Treatment information was not provided. The patient received both scheduled doses of mRNA-1273 prior to the event; therefore, action taken with the drug in response to the event is not applicable. Based on the information provided which includes a temporal association between the use of mRNA-1273 vaccine and onset of the reported events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Nausea, fatigue, and vaccination site pain are consistent with the known safety profile of the vaccine. This case was linked to US-MODERNATX, INC.-MOD-2021-081679 (E2B Linked Report).; Sender's Comments: Based on the information provided which includes a temporal association between the use of mRNA-1273 vaccine and onset of the reported events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. Nausea, fatigue, and vaccination site pain are consistent with the known safety profile of the vaccine, US-MODERNATX, INC.-MOD-2021-081679:cross link Dose 1
41 2021-04-27 dizziness Approximately 3 weeks after Moderna Covid-19 vaccine administration, patient began to experience diz... Read more
Close
Approximately 3 weeks after Moderna Covid-19 vaccine administration, patient began to experience dizziness, transferred to Hospital, diagnosed with ischemic stroke, discharged, returned within days with worsening, diagnosed with new ischemic stroke (contralateral side), transferred to Medical Center, patient's condition worsened, presumably additional new ischemic stroke, patient ultimately died on 3/5/2021. Diagnosis was acute infarction of the brainstem/pons as well as acute bilateral cerebellar/occipital infarctions.

42 2021-01-11 dizziness Sudden fast heart/pounding rate about 30 min after vaccination. Followed by immediate warm feeling,... Read more
Close
Sudden fast heart/pounding rate about 30 min after vaccination. Followed by immediate warm feeling, light headedness (similar to feeling of passing out). Every 10-15 min after that for the next 90 minutes a similar but less intense increase in heart rate would occur. During this next 90 minutes my hands were very tingly and clammy, my adrenaline seemed high, and my throat was suddenly very dry requiring several cups of water. Overall intensity of the heart pounding sensation decreased with each episode and overall my heart felt normal about 2 hrs past vaccination. A headache then developed along with fogginess and persisted the rest of the day.

7 Days after 1st shot - I woke up at 0600HR with slight swelling at injection site on right arm. By 1800HR size of swelling had increased to cover all of upper arm, from elbow to shoulder. Extreme heat and pain followed. Use of Arm limit. Fever increased to 100; Nausea; Fatigue.
42 2021-01-26 mobility decreased I have existing peptic ulcer and acid reflux I have been dealing with for years. I also have elevate... Read more
Close
I have existing peptic ulcer and acid reflux I have been dealing with for years. I also have elevated cholesterol level for which I am being treated. Within 24 hours of receiving the first dose of the Moderna vaccine, the pain from my peptic ulcer went from 2 to 10 on a scale of 10. It became so severe that I could not sit at work. I had to leave work and went back home. Then on January 13, 2021, I started noticing a back pain that radiates throughout my left back side. On January 15, 2021, I went to the ER because the pain was so severe that I could not not lie down, sit, or breath. I was diagnosed with pleurisy (inflammation of the lung linings). The X-ray also showed enlarged heart but the ER doctor said my heart is fine. They also performed EKG on me. I did not mention receiving the vaccine to the ER doctor because I never thought the vaccine could result in such side effects. I did not mention it to my PCP also because I believe the vaccine is safe. But recently I went through the sequence of events myself and the only thing that happened regarding my health was the vaccine. Nothing else. After vaccination, I went to ER on Jan 15, 2021 at around 11:30PM due to severe back pain and was diagnosed with pleurisy through X-ray. My X-ray also showed an enlarged heart but I suspect that was due to the fact that I could not breath properly when the x-ray was taken. I will repeat the X-ray in a couple of weeks. Never experienced pleurisy or heart enlargement in my life prior to the vaccine. Not sure the vaccine was responsible but the coincidence is suspicious.

Close
3 minutes after vaccination the patient began to feel a tingling and pain in his arm where the vaccine was placed. Within minutes the patient began to feel faint and proceeded to faint as he was gently laid to the ground by the healthcare provider to initiate an emergency response. The patient was alert and oriented at 5:30 but felt nausea and a tingling sensation in the tongue. The patient stated that he had been fasting for 2 days and we determined low blood sugar likely played into his response to the vaccine. Glucose gel was placed in mouth and patient felt better within 15 minutes.

Close
I received my first Covid-19 Moderna injection and felt slightly groggy and tired as the day progressed. Just before bed I noticed my arm was quite sore and I still felt tired and slightly light headed. The next day (Feb 4) I had a very sore left arm at the injection site but felt good otherwise. I came home from work and took one 200mg Ibuprofen as my arm was still quite sore. The following day (Feb 5) my arm pain subsided but I still felt light headed during the evening. I am writing this on Feb. 18th and each day I have bouts of being light headed and have difficulty concentrating. There is no real pattern to what time of day I get the symptoms. I do not have the classic headache but definitely feel pressure in my head and behind my eyes. I also find that I wake up after a full nights sleep and feel not well rested. I spoke with my doctor last week and he suggested I give it until this week to see where things are at. I plan on contacting him soon to schedule an appointment to discuss my symptoms more. Before getting the vaccine I did not have any of these symptoms as I describe.

Close
The person who stuck me with that needle injected the vaccine way too high and the entire dose wound up inside my shoulder socket and now I cant use my arm. I know exactly what happened because I've had my other shoulder broken no less than three times. I know exactly what a shoulder socket full of fluid feels like. There is no discerible swelling it redness, and absolutely none of the bruise-like pain normally associated with any if the dozens of vaccinations a person gets throughout their lifetime. The pain is inside my shoulder and comes from trying to use my arm. It feels like my arm is going to come out if the socket if I so much as move my arm away from my body. If this person is doing this to other people then he needs to be stopped ASAP. No names were given. He is a shorter male, medium build, darker skin, (far as I could tell from the PPE), and spoke with a slight accent.

42 2021-03-16 movement disorder I was driving on the highway and experienced numbness starting in my lips. This numbness then moved... Read more
Close
I was driving on the highway and experienced numbness starting in my lips. This numbness then moved throughout my body into my limbs. I had some mobility and was able to pull off of the highway down an exit but at one point, I could not lift my legs or control my hands. I called 911 but it was very difficult to do so with the numbness. I then started to regain my mobility but had some continued numbness around the left side of my mouth. The paramedics tested my vitals and everything came back as normal. They recommended that I have someone come pick me up. So I had a neighbor come pick me up and someone drive my car home. I did not lose any vision or mental capacity throughout this. It was just a wave of numbness throughout my entire body. It lasted 5-10 minutes but felt like an eternity. I am lucky to be alive and to not have crashed my vehicle into someone or something.

Patient verbalized to EMS he felt better. Patent was able to stand and walk on his own and denied any dizziness. EKG was performed by EMS and showed normal sinus rhythm. 43 2021-02-21 dizziness Around 60 seconds after injection my left arm became heavy and tingly/numb, this then occurred in my... Read more
Close
Around 60 seconds after injection my left arm became heavy and tingly/numb, this then occurred in my right thumb as well. I had a heavy sensation on my chest and my heart rate increased rapidly to over 120. This would then resolve slowly and then the tachycardia would recur with the odd sensation over my whole body every ten-15 minutes. EMS was called to take vitals and monitor me. Very odd feeling. I was monitored over the course of 2 hours and when I finally stood up my legs felt heavy and weak as well. After going home and resting things seemed to resolve and I was even able to go out to dinner that evening. The following week I didn't notice much of anything but new symptoms arose around 6 days later on Friday. I would feel strange feeling in my legs and a heaviness. I had a strange dizziness but not vertigo. I felt like I was in slow motion at times. This worsened and I had weakness/fatigue that reached its peak on 1/20/21 and 1/21/21. I was unable to operate on Wednesday as an orthopedic surgeon and had to cancel cases due to this weakness. I saw my doctor that day and had a battery of tests run. CMP, TSH, T4, T3, COVID, COVID IgG, Epstein Barr, Brain MRI, Neruo Consult, ANA, CK, Flu A/B, Vit B12 level, ESR, CRP, Vit D level, EKG, CXR. The following day when I awoke in the morning I felt extremely lethargic and had to cancel clinic. Over the following weeks things have gradually improved but I occasionally get some dizzy/lightheaded moments.
43 2021-02-22 dizziness joint pain, light headed, muscle pain. Low energy. Headache

Close

43 2021-03-06 dizziness Within 48 hours of receiving the COVID vaccine, I began having extreme pressure and discomfort in my... Read more
Close
Within 48 hours of receiving the COVID vaccine, I began having extreme pressure and discomfort in my right ear. Symptoms included dizziness, fullness in the ear and hearing loss. This persisted for several days. As a first course of action, I took Tylenol and antihistamines. I saw my PCP a few days later and he misdiagnosed my condition and suggested that I continue with antihistamines and Flonase. Two weeks later my condition had improved only slightly and I became more concerned. I asked my PCP whether a short course of steroids was warranted (at the suggestion of my mom and wife, who are both health care professionals). He prescribed a "dose pack," which I started on or about Monday, Feb. 22. Later that week, I connected with an ENT who is a friend of a friend . When I told him my story and symptoms he was extremely concerned and got me an immediate appointment on Friday, Feb. 26. At that visit I was diagnosed with acute and severe Sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL) that had resulted in 92% hearing loss in my right ear. Additional symptoms continue to include fullness, tinnitus and other discomfort. None of these issues existed prior to my COVID vaccine shot. I am currently undergoing a treatment of high dose prednisone and steroid injections in my ear. I am scheduled for another visit with doctor on Friday, March 12.

Close
Patient went very pale and limp for about 30 seconds after receiving vaccine 10 minutes prior. patient came to after alcohol prep pads waved under his nose, ice pack placed behind head. patient then ate and drank after coming back, vital signs were normal, B/P was 94/50, pulse 72, respirations 18, @ 850, B/P 104/56, Pulse 71, respirations 18, B/P 110-60. pulse 72 @ 913, patient's significant other called to come drive him home as patient was feeling better but not well enough to drive home. last set of vitals were @ 930 - B/P was 90/58, pulse 72, pulse ox 99%. Patient continued to be perspiring and stated he only felt weird when he looked to the right. S/O did an assessment on patient when he arrived on scene and felt ok to take him home and patient was not critical. patient was advised to go home and rest, go to ER if not feeling better or if he got worse.

Refused to be transported to hospital facility. Allowed to continue to rest for an additional 30 min after which he was picked up by spouse.

He stated that he had shortness of breath for 1-2 minutes and then Slight dizziness and tingling throughout his body that came and went every 4-5 minutes. Close
Fainting for about 30 seconds to a minute in the bathroom; Feeling dizzy; Could not stand for a while when fell; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of SYNCOPE (Fainting for about 30 seconds to a minute in the bathroom) in a 43-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 026B21A and 003A21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included No adverse event. On 09-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 2 dosage form. On 06-Apr-2021 at 5:00 PM, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 2 dosage form. On 07-Apr-2021, the patient experienced DIZZINESS (Feeling dizzy) and DYSSTASIA (Could not stand for a while when fell). On 07-Apr-2021 at 4:00 AM, the patient experienced SYNCOPE (Fainting for about 30 seconds to a minute in the bathroom) (seriousness criterion medically significant). On 07-Apr-2021, DIZZINESS (Feeling dizzy) and DYSSTASIA (Could not stand for a while when fell) had resolved. On 07-Apr-2021 at 4:01 AM, SYNCOPE (Fainting for about 30 seconds to a minute in the bathroom) had resolved. No concomitant medications were reported. Treatment included for the events was acetaminophen. Patient reported that he felt dizzy and fainted for about 30 seconds to 1 minute in his bathroom at around 4:00 am this morning after receiving his second dose of the vaccine yesterday on 6 April 2021.Also, he could not stand for a while when fell. The patient took energy drink. Patient confirmed that the symptom was one time and it has not come back.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

44 2021-02-22 joint range of motion decreased Couldn't feel arm; Couldn't feel arm and had no range in motion; Pain in upper shoulder area by his ... Read more
Close
Couldn't feel arm; Couldn't feel arm and had no range in motion; Pain in upper shoulder area by his neck; Thinks the administration was done incorrectly; Aching in legs as if he was getting sick; Aching in legs as if he was getting sick; Pain in upper shoulder area by his neck; A spontaneous report was received from a nurse concerning her son, who was a 44-year-old male patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced couldn't feel arm and had no range in motion (hypoaesthesia, joint range of motion decreased), pain in upper shoulder area by the neck (arthralgia, neck pain), thinks administration was done incorrectly (product administration error), and aching in legs as if was getting sick (arthralgia, malaise). The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant medication included escitalopram. On 04 Feb 2021, on the same day as the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (batch number: 030L20A) in the left arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 04 Feb 2021, a couple of hours after the vaccination, the patient couldn't feel his arm and he had no range in motion. He also had pain in his upper shoulder area by his neck. The reporter thought the administration was done incorrectly but she "wasn't there to conform 100%." At night on 04 Feb 2021 and 05 Feb 2021, the patient had aching in his legs "as if he was getting sick." Treatment for the events included ibuprofen which helped, and the patient was feeling better at the time of this report. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The events, couldn't feel arm and had no range in motion, pain in upper shoulder area by the neck, and aching in legs as if was getting sick, were considered recovering/resolving at the time of this report. The event, thinks administration was done incorrectly, was considered recovered/resolved on 04 Feb 2021.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 44-year-old male who experienced NS unexpected events of hypoaesthesia, joint range of motion decreased, arthralgia, neck pain, product administration error, malaise, and NS expected arthralgia. The events occurred 1 day after the first dose of mRNA-1273. Events resolved. Based on current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.; Sender's Comments: US-MODERNATX, INC.-MOD-2021-012275: US-MODERNATX, INC.-MOD-2021-012263:

Noted sharp pain in my left shoulder beginning around 4pm today 3/8/2021, and soreness in right hand finger joints beginning this morning 3/8/2021. Also noted sore throat upon swallowing beginning today 3/8/2021 at 11am.

Close
Moderna vaccine dose 1 was administered at around 1:40 PM. Pt reports itchiness, N/V,and dizziness about 10 minutes after injection. Epinephrine 0.3 mg administered IM LVG 15 minutes post vaccine. S/S resolved for about 5-10 minutes. S/S returned including SOB, with throat/tongue/lip swelling and tingling. Started PT on 2 L O2 via NC. Administered another 0.3 mg of epinephrine IM LVG. S/S did not resolve so another 0.3 mg of epinephrine was administered IM LVG. Patient still reported SOB, generalized itchiness, and throat swelling. 125 mg of Solumedrol was then administered IM RVG. 50 mg of diphenhydramine was administered IVP in the left forearm. EMS was called and patient refused transport to hospital. S/S resolved.

44 2021-05-07 gait inability not being able to walk; joint pain; fever, fever getting worse; rash; This spontaneous case was repo... Read more
Close
not being able to walk; joint pain; fever, fever getting worse; rash; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer (subsequently medically confirmed) and describes the occurrence of GAIT INABILITY (not being able to walk), ARTHRALGIA (joint pain) and PYREXIA (fever, fever getting worse) in a 44-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. No Medical History information was reported. On 17-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) 1 dosage form. On 14-Apr-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (unknown route) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 21-Apr-2021, the patient experienced GAIT INABILITY (not being able to walk) (seriousness criterion hospitalization), ARTHRALGIA (joint pain) (seriousness criterion hospitalization) and PYREXIA (fever, fever getting worse) (seriousness criterion hospitalization). 21-Apr-2021, the patient experienced RASH (rash). The patient was hospitalized on 26-Apr-2021 due to ARTHRALGIA, GAIT INABILITY and PYREXIA. At the time of the report, GAIT INABILITY (not being able to walk), ARTHRALGIA (joint pain), PYREXIA (fever, fever getting worse) and RASH (rash) had not resolved. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not Applicable. Concomitant and treatment information not provided. Company comment:Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. This case was linked to MOD-2021-097707 (Patient Link).; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

I still felt lightheaded but could breathe freely and easily. There was no noticeable swelling impairing my breathing. Initially i could not get a reading on my pulse oximeter. I have had a low grade fever (99.5) for a week now. I have had insomnia since the night of the injection. EVERY night I wake up hot 3 hours after I went to sleep. I have never gotten the chills, only hot. I usually need to take a sleep aid to get back to sleep which is NOT normal for me. Many times I wake up again 3 hours later even after the sleep aid hot. My lack of sleep has really been hard on my daytime working and living at this point. When I wake at night hot my temperature is usually 99.5, but has been a bit lower at times too. I also feel that I have rapid heart rate at this time (when I try to fall back asleep) and it seems as if my heart is beating harder than normal. I also feel a buzzing in my head like I drank too much coffee type of feeling. The first couple of days I felt tired and weak and a bit achy throughout the day. The next few days after that I felt dizzy and light headed with a headache. The first few days I also noticed slight muscle spasms throughout my arms and torso particularly when I laid down at night to go to bed and was still and relaxed. I have been taking over the counter pain/fever pills usually for the headache. I contacted my doctor and he said to give it a week. It has been a week yesterday, but Dr is closed for weekends and Fridays. I went to urgent care on Friday and they were not helpful (virtually). They said give it 5 more days!!!!! I am extremely tired of this and worried at how long it has been. NOBODY I know with the first shot has had this reaction. My wife is nervous as well and we would really like to hear something that may ease our minds at this point. Some explanation as to why my body may be reacting this way, or if any others have had this same situation.

Close
I was feeling cold throughout the day, at about 9:00 pm I took a shower to try to get warmed up, I just kept getting colder and colder until I was severely shaking uncontrollably. Every muscle was so tense and I was shaking so badly I could barely walk or breathe. I went to the bedroom and got under blankets with a heater and in a few minutes the shaking diminished to where I could start breathing normal again. It took about an hour before my shakiness went away completely but I still needed to stay under the blankets and near the heater as I felt I was still cold and on the verge of getting the severe chills again. I had no fever. Next morning (as I'm writing) I'm still worried about getting out of bed as I still don't feel right and am scared of getting the chills like that again.

massive blood clot in the right lung; painful knot under the skin on his arm; threw up about 20 times in 6 hours, and kept vomiting all the next day; massive blood clot in the lung ended up in different parts of the lung causing extreme amount or pain\ Left lung is beginning to hurt again and his chest is killing him; next day when he got up and could barely walk; This spontaneous case was reported by a consumer and describes the occurrence of PULMONARY EMBOLISM (massive blood clot in the right lung), PULMONARY PAIN (massive blood clot in the lung ended up in different parts of the lung causing extreme amount or pain\ Left lung is beginning to hurt again and his chest is killing him) and THROMBOSIS (painful knot under the skin on his arm) in a 45-year-old male patient who received mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (batch nos. 027A21A and 007B21A) for COVID-19 vaccination. The occurrence of additional non-serious events is detailed below. The patient's past medical history included Autoimmune disorder NOS in September 2020 and Broken bones. On 18-Mar-2021, the patient received first dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) 1 dosage form. On 15-Apr-2021, received second dose of mRNA-1273 (Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine) (Intramuscular) dosage was changed to 1 dosage form. On 19-Mar-2021, the patient experienced GAIT DISTURBANCE (next day when he got up and could barely walk). On 26-Mar-2021, the patient experienced PULMONARY EMBOLISM (massive blood clot in the right lung) (seriousness criteria hospitalization, medically significant and life threatening). On 04-Apr-2021, the patient experienced PULMONARY PAIN (massive blood clot in the lung ended up in different parts of the lung causing extreme amount or pain\ Left lung is beginning to hurt again and his chest is killing him) (seriousness criterion medically significant). On an unknown date, the patient experienced THROMBOSIS (painful knot under the skin on his arm) (seriousness criterion medically significant) and VOMITING (threw up about 20 times in 6 hours, and kept vomiting all the next day). On 19-Mar-2021, GAIT DISTURBANCE (next day when he got up and could barely walk) outcome was unknown. On 28-Mar-2021, PULMONARY EMBOLISM (massive blood clot in the right lung) had not resolved. On 04-Apr-2021, PULMONARY PAIN (massive blood clot in the lung ended up in different parts of the lung causing extreme amount or pain\ Left lung is beginning to hurt again and his chest is killing him) had not resolved. At the time of the report, THROMBOSIS (painful knot under the skin on his arm) and VOMITING (threw up about 20 times in 6 hours, and kept vomiting all the next day) outcome was unknown. Not Provided Treatment information provided as blood thinners (IV heparin) and antibiotics were used to treat the events. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. This case was linked to US-MODERNATX, INC.-MOD-2021-081632 (E2B Linked Report).; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded. US-MODERNATX, INC.-MOD-2021-081632:2nd dose

46 2021-01-14 dizziness Patient report sudden onset of weakness, dizziness, and feeling like he was going to pass out about ... Read more
Close
Patient report sudden onset of weakness, dizziness, and feeling like he was going to pass out about twenty minutes after receiving his vaccine. Paramedic on-duty observed patient to pale and diaphoretic and immediately brought all equipment to patient's side and began care. Patient was placed on cardiac monitor and was observed to be markedly hypotensive and bradycardic. Peripheral IV established and atropine administered followed by fluid bolus. A transport unit was requested and arrived within minutes. Patient was assisted to EMS stretcher and transported emergently to the hospital for futher treatment and evaluation.

46 2021-01-16 mobility decreased Patient woke up on the sixth day following vaccination unable to move head. He complained of stiffn... Read more
Close
Patient woke up on the sixth day following vaccination unable to move head. He complained of stiffness/tightness from the injection in left deltoid up the trapezius muscle to the back of the neck. He told his wife he could not move his neck & she began to massage the neck muscle. The muscle gradually loosened up with continued massage. He also applied topical muscle rub (Tiger Balm) to the area and took some ibuprofen. When he reported to work later that morning he continued to complain of tightness and some discomfort in the left arm leading to the back of his neck, although from visual observation he did not to appear to be in any pain or discomfort or have any trouble moving his neck. Symptoms persisted for apx. two more days and was treated with topical rub, massage, and ibuprofen.

46 2021-01-27 dizziness Patient reported symptoms of nausea and severe lightheadedness approximately 10 minutes after vaccin... Read more
Close
Patient reported symptoms of nausea and severe lightheadedness approximately 10 minutes after vaccine administration. Symptoms progressed and patient report feeling itchy with throat tightness. New onset of rash on bilateral forearms. He was elevated by Doctor with recommendation to be transported to the local Emergency Department. Patient refused to be transported and asked to stay on-site for continued observations. Patient's symptoms failed to resolve after 45 minutes, rescue team was called. They presented and evaluated patient with recommendations to be transported to the local Emergency Department. Patient declined transport to the hospital. Rescue team spoke with the Emergency Department, the decision was made and the patient agreed to an additional hour of observation with the understanding if symptoms didn't resolve they would be transported to the Emergency Department. Symptoms unchanged after 1 hour, patient made the decision to leave and follow up with their Primary Care Physician.

I received my Moderna COVID-19 Vaccination at approximately 0800 am on February 10, 2021. At approximately 1800 hrs the same day, I experienced a sudden onset of muscle spasms to my lower back. I was at rest, sitting in a chair at the time of onset. The muscle spasm to my lower back was extremely intense and I had difficulty walking. This continued for about 1.5 hours. Also, during this time, I experienced cramping to the arches of both my feet. This was intermittent. I also had pain/soreness to my hips bilaterally. After approximately 1.5 hours the lower back spasms and cramping to my feet subsided. I do not have a history of lower back issues and this is my first experience of spasms of my lower back.

47 2021-02-24 dizziness About 3-5 minutes after getting the vaccine began experiencing a light headedness feeling. Took my b... Read more
Close
About 3-5 minutes after getting the vaccine began experiencing a light headedness feeling. Took my blood pressure and it was a little high (140/95), I attributed this to anxiety but got home and my BP at home was down to about 120/76 about 1 hr. after. I laid down to sleep it off but could not sleep as about 1 hr. after trying to go to sleep I started to get a headache. After about 2 hours of battling it I decided to take a Extra Strength Tylenol which helped with the headache about 2 hrs later is was almost gone but the feeling of lightheadedness/dizziness was still there a bit worse than at the beginning. I slept it off and the next morning it was about 50 % better and by about noon it seemed to be 99% better. Today is Thursday ( on my 3rd day) and still feel a slight dizziness but I also have seasonal allergies which sometimes give me the same symptoms. I expect to be better soon.
47 2021-02-26 gait disturbance, inability to stand, mobility decreased On 2/23/21, about 12 days after the vaccine was received, I felt chest pains in the late afternoon. ... Read more
Close
On 2/23/21, about 12 days after the vaccine was received, I felt chest pains in the late afternoon. At midnight, I woke up with uncontrollable chills and shakes, with a low-grade fever that hovered in the 99.5 -100 range. I attempted to get up and struggled to breathe,; it was as if my abdominal and lower back muscles were seizing. I had to crawl to a kneeling position to urinate. I took several Tylenol then went back to lie down; after a few hours, the fever subsided, and I was able to briefly fall back asleep. At 4:00 a.m. the fever and major chills subsided, with no fevers reported since then, and only occasional chills. However, the muscle fatigue, pain and stiffness have become frighteningly debilitating. On Wednesday - Friday, the three days after I first experienced symptoms, each day it took me between 1.5 - 2 hours to get out of bed and finally get to a standing position. During the day on each day following my first symptoms, I have been able to gradually walk around, go up and down stairs, use the bathroom, and perform basic tasks. However, when the evening comes, it is a different story. 12 midnight - 10 a.m. are the worst hours, as any extended period lying down results in my muscles seizing, freezing and stiffening up. After falling asleep for an hour, it takes 10-20 minutes to mobilize enough (using a crutch and assistance) to get to the bathroom. After falling asleep for 2-3 hours, it takes 30-40 minutes to do the same. And, if I fall asleep for 3+ hours (which is about as long as I've been able to sleep since the adverse reactions began), it will take 1.5 - 2 hours to get completely mobile. This is when I finally wake for the day, and it takes about 10 minutes to raise my head and turn my torso, then another 10-15 minutes to get my legs off the bed and assume a crouching position, then 30-60 minutes to stand on my own.
47 2021-03-02 dizziness Patient Started having dizziness, feeling faint at around midnight on 3/3/2021. He then lost conscio... Read more
Close
Patient Started having dizziness, feeling faint at around midnight on 3/3/2021. He then lost consciousness, had seizure-like activity and was taken to hospital via EMS. In the hospital patient was unresponsive and received resuscitation attempts unsuccessfully. Per family, after about 45 minutes, code was called and patient expired.

He took my heart rate and check my blood sugar. He said my vitals looked ok. He asked if i was feeling better. I was still very dizzy and nauseous. i sat in the parking log for awhile before driving home. I got home and went to bed slept most of the day. I had a fairly bad headache the rest of the evening and a slight nauseous feeling. The next morning i still have a slight headache still feel slight nausea but not bad.

5 minutes after patient received vaccine he started to become lightheaded, dizzy, tingling in bilateral arms, pale, diaphoretic and hypotensive. Pt leaned forward out of chair and got on the floor, BP 74/46 P 52 O2 sats 96%, pt remained alert and oriented speaking in clear full sentences. Pt remained in this state for approx 20 min, symptoms started to subsided and by approx 1 hour after injection pt BP was 119/74 and all symptoms had resolved and patient was released to home care.

Close
Recipient reported feeling light-headed after receiving COVID Vaccine. He reported similar symptoms after receiving a flu vaccine. He was observed for 15 minutes and no additional symptoms. He had some fruit juice and accompanied to his car where he chose to rest. He called after 15-20 minutes and lightheadedness had not resolved. returned and individual continue to rest in his car. 3:17 - BP - 152/92, HR - 83 and pulse oximeter - 98% 3:23 - BP 145/88, HR - 83 3:40pm Individual called PCP and spoke with nurse who reported that she would relay information to MD. 3:55 - Individual reclining in car and reports feeling better. Rates lightheadedness a 3 on a 10 point scale. Denies dizziness and nausea. 4:15pm Discussed options of going to hospital or having family member pick up. Individual able to return to workplace and then home after reporting that he felt better.
